For light to emerge from the glass, the angle of incidence must be less than the critical angle.
The length of the light-emitting part is proportional to the angle of incidence and the geometry of the wedge.
Using trigonometric relationships, find the ratio of the length of the light-emitting part to the total length of the edge.
